featured.name: Gatlin
featured.title: From Three Jobs to Career Dreams: Gatlin's Transportation Victory
featured.situation: 19-year-old caring for younger siblings while working three jobs
featured.quote: When we met Gatlin, he was caring for his younger siblings and working three jobs at just 19 years old—all without a vehicle of his own! His goal is to become a corrections officer and then a police officer. The obstacle he faced was transportation, forcing him to depend on others for rides.
fullTestimony: When we met Gatlin, he was caring for his younger siblings and working three jobs at just 19 years old—all without a vehicle of his own! His goal is to become a corrections officer and then a police officer.
The obstacle he faced was transportation, forcing him to depend on others for rides. Even so, he was faithful to his employment and was serving others through small groups and church youth ministry.
The Ladder provided him with a car, so he has been able to continue to help his family and serve his community, while pursuing his career goals.
outcomes: Continued faithful employment at three jobs
Able to care for younger siblings
Pursuing career goals in law enforcement
featured.currentStatus: Pursuing career goals as corrections officer and police officer while serving family and community

stories.name: Victoria
stories.title: Single Mom's Transportation Crisis to New Job Success
stories.situation: Single mother with two children lost car in accident
stories.quote: I am a single mom with two small children. When I lost my car in an accident that was not my fault, I was stuck in my apartment and feeling anxious and depressed, as I had no transportation to get to work and grocery stores, take my son to school, etc.
outcomes: Found new job that she loves
stories.currentStatus: New job that she loves and moved into a beautiful new home

stories.name: Craig
stories.title: Breaking the High-Interest Debt Trap
stories.situation: Financial difficulties from high-interest vehicle loan during divorce
stories.quote: Craig was in financial straits because he had borrowed against his vehicle during a divorce. The high interest rate on this loan kept him trapped.
outcomes: Received zero-interest loan from The Ladder
stories.currentStatus: Moving forward financially, repaying zero-interest loan to help others
stories.thankYouNote: Craig's thank you note reminds us why we do what we do

stories.name: Jennifer
stories.title: Recovery Success: From Debt to Housing Stability
stories.situation: Single mother in recovery saddled with debt
stories.quote: Jennifer is a single mother in recovery. She has overcome many obstacles and is moving forward in her life, but she is saddled with debt.
outcomes: High-interest credit cards paid off (half gifted, half loaned at 0%)
stories.currentStatus: Moving into permanent housing with improved credit score

stories.name: Jamil & Erika
stories.title: From Homelessness to Family Transportation Solution
stories.situation: Family with six children overcame homelessness after losing everything in car fire
stories.quote: The Ladder is an amazing group of people who offer guidance, assistance, and mentoring to people in need. They are the true hands and feet of Jesus.
outcomes: Both parents working hard to provide
Continued service through Birmingham Dream Center
stories.currentStatus: Both working to provide for six children with reliable family transportation

stories.name: Kim & Woody
stories.title: Medical Crisis Housing Relief
stories.situation: Disabled wife and working husband faced homelessness after medical emergency
stories.quote: I just want to thank the Ladder for your help. I'm disabled and my husband works a job with no benefits or time off. When he ended up in the hospital with two surgeries we got behind on our rent.
outcomes: Rent paid for one month during crisis
Husband able to recover and return to work
stories.currentStatus: Husband has better job, looking forward to even better opportunities

stories.name: Brandon & Candy
stories.title: Caring for Seven: Roof Repair for Foster Family
stories.situation: Young couple caring for seven children whose families couldn't care for them
stories.quote: Brandon & Candy are a hard-working young couple with a huge heart for children. They are caring for seven children whose families of origin could not care for them.
outcomes: Brandon and his father completed repairs
Ensured safety and comfort for all children
stories.currentStatus: Continuing to care for seven children in safe, comfortable home

stories.name: Asha
stories.title: Widow's Recovery: From Job Loss to Career Development
stories.situation: Single mother raising three children after husband's murder in 2019
stories.quote: Asha is raising her three children alone since her husband was murdered in 2019. She works hard to care for them, but suffered a setback when her vehicle had mechanical issues.
outcomes: Past-due water and utility bills paid
partnerOrganizations: Partner nonprofit for job search guidance
stories.currentStatus: Actively job searching with career development support

stories.name: Recovery Client
stories.title: Climbing the Ladder to Sobriety
stories.situation: Man working toward sobriety after years of challenges
stories.quote: One man is climbing the ladder to sobriety after years of difficult challenges.
outcomes: Rent and utilities covered during treatment
stories.currentStatus: Climbing his ladder to success in ongoing recovery

stories.name: D.J. & Rachel
stories.title: Family Growth: From Four to Seven
stories.situation: Family grew from 4 to 7 when they took in sister's three teenagers
stories.quote: D. J. and Rachel's family grew from 4 to 7 when they took in his sister's three teenagers after their mother suffered a tragic accident.
outcomes: Van purchased for larger family needs
stories.currentStatus: Successfully caring for family of seven with appropriate transportation

stories.name: Tonia
stories.title: From Shelter to Permanent Home
stories.situation: Mother and young son living in shelter due to housing loss
stories.quote: Tonia had lost her apartment and was living in a shelter with her young son.
outcomes: Able to move forward from shelter
stories.currentStatus: Moved into permanent home with son

stories.name: Tim
stories.title: COVID and Cancer: New Business Opportunity
stories.situation: Career affected by COVID-19 shutdowns, then diagnosed with cancer
stories.quote: Tim's career was greatly affected by the shutdowns in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. And then he was also diagnosed with cancer.
outcomes: Ability to support family during health crisis
stories.currentStatus: Running at-home business to support family during cancer treatment

stories.name: Trey & Jennifer
stories.title: Medical Emergency Job Loss Recovery
stories.situation: Husband lost job after knee injury, recovery longer than expected
stories.quote: My husband lost his job when he hurt his knee and told his employer that he needed to have surgery. Recovery was longer than expected and so was getting hired at a new company.
outcomes: Financial assistance prevented debt and late fees
Mortgage, power, and water bills covered
Avoided credit issues and worse consequences
stories.currentStatus: Husband re-hired, family continuing to climb thanks to The Ladder

partnerTestimonials.title: Representative
partnerTestimonials.testimonial: Grace Klein Community is thankful for our partnership with The Ladder. When one of our long-term volunteers found herself in a difficult financial situation after taking in extra people and facing personal illness, The Ladder assisted her with a water bill. The Ladder empowered our volunteer to continue living out Jesus' teachings in John 15:13, 'Greater love has no one than this: to lay down one's life for one's friends.'

partnerTestimonials.title: Partner Organization
partnerTestimonials.testimonial: We've seen firsthand how The Ladder's support enables families like Jamil and Erika's to continue serving our community even while overcoming their own challenges. Their transportation assistance allowed this family to maintain their volunteer commitments while caring for six children.
